sense.name: Make straight; extricate from entanglement.
sense.commentary: INCLUDES: STRAIGHTEN UP, STRAIGHTEN OUT syntax is: NP1[agent] STRAIGHTEN NP2[concrete] NP1[agent] STRAIGHTEN NP2[patient]
sense.examples: Can you straighten out the cord? John straightened his hair for the 80's party. Straighten the post before laying concrete.

sense.name: Get up from sitting or slouching position; make oneself more upright (literally).
sense.examples: The students straightened when the teacher entered. He straightened himself up when he spoke to his superiors.

sense.name: Put (things or places) in order; settle or put right; change for the better; remove ambiguity.
sense.examples: Straighten up your room. We need to straighten out our disagreements. The lazy student straightened out.
